page.title: 14Caravan life in Newark
page.content: The gypsy woman lived in a mobile home which was siver and white and highly polished. She told us that the biggest caravan on the site is 36 feet long and the smallest is 20 feet long. She was a true gypsy and liked her life in a mobile home. She had been there for two weeks but usually stays for 6 months. Her weekly costs were about 15 pounds. She had no trouble from lorry drivers. The rules of the site were: 1.All sites must be kept litter free. 2.No dogs. 3.All rents paid promptly. 4.No subletting. 5.Rents reviewed annually. 6.Any person may sell a caravan on the site provided the site owner receives 10% of the profit!
